info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 04 at 6:49PM MST until September 04 at 8:30PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN MOHAVE COUNTY... At 649 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms finally weakening over much of Mohave County. Very heavy rain fell earlier, and flash flooding is still a concern. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kingman, Yucca, Golden Valley and New Kingman-Butler. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
